query: Should I use get_node with detail='standard' or detail='full' when configuring a new node? What's the difference?
expected_behavior: Recommends get_node detail='standard' for configuration-first workflows
Explains standard includes required fields and core options
Explains detail='full' returns complete schema (use when standard is insufficient)
Suggests starting with detail='standard', escalate to detail='full' if needed
May provide telemetry/performance insight from skill guidance
